   "source": [
    "# General Optics"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "id": "599f704d-edf0-4c94-a81e-fa5578561d6b",
   "metadata": {

   "source": [
    "%matplotlib inline\n",
    "import ipywidgets as widgets\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "import numpy as np"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "05fcfec6-661c-41ca-9e95-3241689140bc",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "#### Total Internal Reflection"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "c8a502c9-dc6e-49ea-b54f-edd5c8adfdb6",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "If we now consider the outgoing angle $\\theta_2$ as a function of the incident angle $\\theta_1$, we obtain a characteristic plot, which looks for the materials glass ($n=1.5$) and air ($n=1$) like below. If the incident light is coming from air and following onto glass, we can change the incident angle up to $90$ degree, but only reach an outgoing angle of $41.8$ degree. If we reverse the materials, however, an outgoing angle is reached and an angle of incidence of $41.8$ degree. Light at larger incident angles is not anymore refracted out of the glass but reflected into the glass. Therefore, this phenomenon is called **total internal reflection**. It has some fantastic applications."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 5,
   "id": "001bf9a0-a84a-4248-aee2-54cdbbabdaac",
   "metadata": {
    "nbsphinx": "hidden",
    "tags": []
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 600x600 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "def snell_law(n1, n2, theta1_degrees):\n",
    "    theta1_radians = np.radians(theta1_degrees)\n",
    "    sin_theta2 = n1 / n2 * np.sin(theta1_radians)\n",
    "    \n",
    "    # Check for total internal reflection\n",
    "    if sin_theta2 > 1:\n",
    "        # Total internal reflection, no refraction\n",
    "        return np.nan  # Use NaN to indicate no refraction occurs\n",
    "    else:\n",
    "        theta2_radians = np.arcsin(sin_theta2)\n",
    "        return np.degrees(theta2_radians)\n",
    "\n",
    "theta1 = np.linspace(0, 90, 1000)\n",
    "\n",
    "n1_glass = 1.5\n",
    "n2_air = 1.0\n",
    "\n",
    "theta2_glass_to_air = np.array([snell_law(n1_glass, n2_air, angle) for angle in theta1])\n",
    "plt.figure(figsize=(4, 4),dpi=150)\n",
    "plt.plot(theta1, theta2_glass_to_air,\"k\", label='n1=1.5 to n2=1.0')\n",
    "theta_c = np.degrees(np.arcsin(n2_air / n1_glass))\n",
    "plt.axvline(x=theta_c, color='k', linestyle='--', label=f'Critical angle c = {theta_c:.2f}')\n",
    "\n",
    "n1_glass = 1.0\n",
    "n2_air = 1.5\n",
    "theta2_glass_to_air = np.array([snell_law(n1_glass, n2_air, angle) for angle in theta1])\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.plot(theta1, theta2_glass_to_air,\"k\", label='n1=1.5 to n2=1.0')\n",
    "plt.plot(theta1, theta1,\"k\")\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.xlabel(r'$_1$ (degrees)')\n",
    "plt.ylabel(r'$_2$ (degrees)')\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.xlim(0, 90)\n",
    "plt.ylim(0, 90)\n",
    "plt.grid(True)\n",
    "plt.show()\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 6,
   "id": "beb9ecb8-95f3-4e33-b408-a19945e7ad0c",
   "metadata": {

   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 400x400 with 1 Axes>"

     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"

   ],
   "source": [
    "fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(4, 4))\n",
    "fig.canvas.header_visible = False\n",
    "#@widgets.interact(n1=(1,2,0.01),n2=(1,3,0.01), angle=(0, 90, 0.1))\n",
    "def update(n1=1,n2=1.5,angle=45):\n",
    "    \"\"\"Remove old lines from plot and plot new one\"\"\"\n",
    "    ax.cla()\n",
    "    theta1=angle*np.pi/180\n",
    "    if n1*np.sin(theta1)/n2<=1:\n",
    "        theta2=np.arcsin(n1*np.sin(theta1)/n2)\n",
    "    else:\n",
    "        theta2=-theta1+np.pi\n",
    "    #ax.set_title(\"Refraction Explorer\")    \n",
    "    ax.axvline(x=0,ls='--')\n",
    "    ax.text(-0.04,0.04,r'$n_2$={}'.format(n2))\n",
    "    ax.text(-0.04,-0.04,r'$n_1$={}'.format(n1))\n",
    "    ax.text(0.03,0.04,r'$\\theta_2$={}'.format(round(theta2*180/np.pi),1))\n",
    "    ax.text(0.03,-0.04,r'$\\theta_1$={}'.format(round(theta1*180/np.pi),1))\n",
    "\n",
    "\n",
    "    ax.axhline(y=0,color='k',lw=0.5)\n",
    "    ax.quiver(0,0,np.sin(theta1),np.cos(theta1),scale=3,pivot='tip' ,color='red')\n",
    "    ax.quiver(0,0,np.sin(theta2),np.cos(theta2),scale=3,color='blue')  \n",
    "    \n",
    "update(n1=1.,n2=1.5,angle=41.9)"
   ]
  }
